title: Default dark theme + token-aligned public project styling

requirements.summary: Make dark mode the default app theme using existing Tailwind CSS variables and ThemeProvider, ensuring consistency across signed-in and signed-out UI.
acceptanceCriteria: On first load in a fresh browser session, the app renders in dark mode without requiring the user to change OS/system theme settings.
The dark theme applies consistently across the authenticated shell (header/footer/layout), dashboard, project editor, and dialogs.
No user-facing text is changed to non-English as part of this update.

file_operations.description: Update the existing next-themes ThemeProvider configuration so the app defaults to dark mode on first load (do not rely on system theme), while keeping the existing ThemeProvider setup intact.

Align the signed-out landing page background and accents with the variable-based design tokens (bg-background/text-foreground, card/muted/primary) so it renders correctly and consistently under the default dark theme (no user-facing text changes).

Replace hardcoded light/dark/custom background/text classes with token-based styling and theme-appropriate typography (e.g., readable prose in dark mode) to keep previews consistent with the app’s Tailwind CSS variable theme system and default dark mode.

requirements.summary: Refactor the public project page to use design tokens (no hardcoded gray/purple) and render readable markdown in dark mode consistent with the app palette direction.
acceptanceCriteria: When a published project uses the 'dark' theme, the public page has correct contrast for text, links, and prose content.
The public page does not use a purple/pink-based 'custom' background styling; it follows the app’s established palette direction.
Links and markdown-rendered content remain readable and visually consistent with the rest of the app theme tokens.

file_operations.description: Remove hardcoded themeClasses (gray backgrounds and purple/pink custom gradient) and restyle the page using existing Tailwind theme tokens (bg-background/text-foreground, card/muted/primary). Ensure markdown/prose and links render with appropriate contrast in dark mode and stay aligned with the app’s non-blue/non-purple palette direction.
